Articles.Content: Thats really cool

So, I am with you again. I have given the Buran and Energia Dragon, he is engaged in cfg file, converts Buran in birdie. A new foto. 

[![9089144_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1434905626/d390e599/9089144_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/d390e5999089144.html) [![9089145_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1434905629/efcba2cd/9089145_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/efcba2cd9089145.html) [![9089146_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1434905631/6f60fce0/9089146_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/6f60fce09089146.html) [![9089147_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1434905633/4d0ec7d1/9089147_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/4d0ec7d19089147.html) 

 Buran will have several versions,at the moment it has only two. You can offer their own versions of the title, I'll translate them into Russian and make a new version of the Shuttle. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Also soon make a parachute,and wait cfg file from Dragon01. Then follow the release.
Looks great!

> 
> In case you wanted more source material for your models, thats all.

Such a shame that the new Russian Republic(or whatever they're called) decided not to resurrect the Buran Program!

The 2 unfinished shuttles have been sitting in a rotting hanger since the late 80's i do not think they would ever fly.

![93b24d9b04cf36b10688e10614930c21.jpg](https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/93/b2/4d/93b24d9b04cf36b10688e10614930c21.jpg)

The one working shuttle that flew once was destroyed when the hanger collapsed.

![buran-damaged.jpg](http://www.aerospaceweb.org/question/spacecraft/buran/buran-damaged.jpg)

Kudos to you decq. The NASA shuttle was a open project everyone saw and could learn about. The USSR was not so forthcoming with their "military" aircraft. The original plans where even lost during the fall of the USSR so i really commend you on your work in getting such great accuracy and detail on a very secretive (and historical) orbiter. Im looking forward to using your mod when its released.

> 
> Such a shame that the new Russian Republic(or whatever they're called) decided not to resurrect the Buran Program!

 "Russian Republic(or whatever they're called)" please,show me this the country on the map......

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-23T10:06:28Z" title="06/23/2015 10:06  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 23, 2015</time> by DECQ**

> 
> "Russian Republic" please,show me the country on the map...

I think he was referring to the Russian Federation to distinguish the difference between it and the USSR. Far as i understand the Russian Federation never took ownership of the Buran it died when the USSR dissolved.

> 
> The 2 unfinished shuttles have been sitting in a rotting hanger since the late 80's i do not think they would ever fly.
> [https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/93/b2/4d/93b24d9b04cf36b10688e10614930c21.jpg](https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/93/b2/4d/93b24d9b04cf36b10688e10614930c21.jpg)
> 
> The one working shuttle that flew once was destroyed when the hanger collapsed.
> 
> [http://www.aerospaceweb.org/question/spacecraft/buran/buran-damaged.jpg](http://www.aerospaceweb.org/question/spacecraft/buran/buran-damaged.jpg)
> 
> Kudos to you decq. The NASA shuttle was a open project everyone saw and could learn about. The USSR was not so forthcoming with their "military" aircraft. The original plans where even lost during the fall of the USSR so i really commend you on your work in getting such great accuracy and detail on a very secretive (and historical) orbiter. Im looking forward to using your mod when its released.

Space Shuttle same "military" as the Buran. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Such a shame this equipment is left to rot when it could still be used, might need a bit of an overhaul but a great piece of history condemned to die in a forgotten hangar
Are you joking? in the 90s Russia was bankrupt.

> 
> Space Shuttle same "military" as the Buran. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Please don't misunderstand my comment as insensitive i highly respect the Russian space program and feel it has definitely made its name. My point is that early on the Buran was not as public as NASA put their shuttle out to be in the beginning. It also only flew once which is a shame.

The Russian Buran was known to exceed nearly every spec of the NASA shuttle which is an amazing task. It could haul more, it could handle higher temperatures, it could fly itself and eventually it was planned to have atmospheric engines to allow it to land nearly anywhere in the world or transport itself back to its home base (removing the need for the Antonov 225) and finally to top it off it used LFO instead of solid fuel on energia which was more efficient and safe. What an amazing spacecraft and if Russia was able to continue the project i feel it would have paved the way for the next generation of space shuttles.

Indeed, thats a pretty addition to the orbiter collection. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) But decq's energija will kill the RAM again ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Please don't misunderstand my comment as insensitive i highly respect the Russian space program and feel it has definitely made its name. My point is that early on the Buran was not as public as NASA put their shuttle out to be in the beginning. It also only flew once which is a shame.
> The Russian Buran was known to exceed nearly every spec of the NASA shuttle which is an amazing task. It could haul more, it could handle higher temperatures, it could fly itself and eventually it was planned to have atmospheric engines to allow it to land nearly anywhere in the world or transport itself back to its home base (removing the need for the Antonov 225) and finally to top it off it used LFO instead of solid fuel on energia which was more efficient and safe. What an amazing spacecraft and if Russia was able to continue the project i feel it would have paved the way for the next generation of space shuttles.

I understand you correctly, do not worry. Although the exterior was taken from the Space Shuttle NASA (plagiarism), although these were very different machines, despite the appearance. But do not worry, we will renew the program "Energy-Buran", at least in the KSP. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

But the payload, and the first docking!!!.

[![9113888_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1435153439/19db3054/9113888_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/19db30549113888.html) [![9113889_m.png](http://images.vfl.ru/ii/1435153442/e7e5590c/9113889_m.png)](http://vfl.ru/fotos/e7e5590c9113889.html) 

 True when returning Buran flies like a brick with wings. I look forward to working Dragon01, even a little help,in configuring a complete aerodynamics I do not understand nothing.

I've converted all textures to DDS now, Decq. 

I must say that while having some atmospheric flight problems Buran is excellent nonetheless!

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/XNkLb)

The only problem I ran into was with the docking module. MechJeb and the stock targeting system don't understand where the port is and are 90 degrees off of where they should be. This means that you have to dock your stations to Buran and not the other way around.

Also excellent job with the hatch!
Pre Release version pls, i want to test this baby \*\_\*

> 
> Pre Release version pls, i want to test this baby \*\_\*

 It flies like a brick, it's no fun to return it to Kerbin as it will fall apart or crash before landing.

> 
> It flies like a brick, it's no fun to return it to Kerbin as it will fall apart or crash before landing.

trying to make the pretty brick fly is fun though, even if i cant land it like a plane i think it would be interesting to play with
